definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
People's Action Party (ruling party in Singapore)
to put into action/to transform into acts
the two mass scuttling operations carried out by the German navy: the scuttling of the German fleet at Scapa Flow in 1919 and Operation Regenbogen, the scuttling of U-boats in 1945
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue

pinyin: huan2 jing4 xing2 dong4 zhu3 yi4

definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about
(gaming) action points (points required to complete an action)/(Tw) action level (the level of concentration of a harmful substance at which remedial action is considered necessary)
(Tw) street theater (esp. as a form of political expression)

sentences.english: Time is not on our side. We need to keep moving forward and we need to move fast.
sentences.chinese: 时不我待，我们必须不断前进，行动迅速。

sentences.english: Shen Cheng is a project official with the animal-protection group ACTAsia.
sentences.chinese: 沈成，动物保护组织“行动亚洲”项目官员。

sentences.english: The onus now is on the government of Pakistan to act with sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦政府现在有责任采取有诚意的行动。

sentences.english: It's like having an array of stomp boxes ready for action.
sentences.chinese: 它有一个数组的单块效果器随时准备采取相应的行动。

sentences.english: The point of our pacification operations was always described as "winning the hearts and minds" of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我们绥靖行动的意义过去一贯被描写为“深得人心。”

sentences.english: His actions led to a death sentence, which was later commuted to a prison term.
sentences.chinese: 郗浩良的行动导致被判处死刑，后来减为有期徒刑。

sentences.english: Drache to confidential action content, therefore has not to clarify in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 卓凯为了保密行动内容，故一直没有就此事作出澄清。

sentences.english: The dense forest screened the guerrillas' movements.
sentences.chinese: 密林掩护了游击队员的行动。

sentences.english: Bokova that media facilities should not be the target of military operations.
sentences.chinese: 博科娃指出，媒体设施不应当成为军事行动的目标。

sentences.english: A solo violin carried the theme in “The Fixer”;
sentences.chinese: 在《暗影行动》中，主题曲由小提琴独奏出。

sentences.english: Each side tries to anticipate the actions of the other.
sentences.chinese: 每一方都试图预测另一方的行动。

sentences.english: Don't give me any lip service. I want to see some action!
sentences.chinese: 别对我说好听的，我要见你的行动。

sentences.english: Be gentle when washing your face and hair or using cosmetics.
sentences.chinese: 洗脸，梳头和用化妆品时，行动要柔柔等。

sentences.english: And these various feedback mechanisms quickly facilitate jumpstarting the necessary people into action.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈机制能够及时协助有关人员迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: So, in order to move fast, we have to stand on giants' shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 因此，为了行动迅速，我们需要站在巨人的肩膀上。

sentences.english: In order for these techniques to be effective, you have to act on them.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这些方法变得有效，你必须据此采取行动。

plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
to launch/to develop/to unfold/(of an exhibition etc) to open

to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
to implement/to carry out/to execute/to run
